intro: Erigeron abajoensis, commonly known as the Abajo fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Erigeron abajoensis is often found in desert scrub and grassland ecosystems.
